intro: Centaurea adscendens, commonly known as the ascending centaurea, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features slender, branching stems covered with fine hairs and produces vibrant blue to purple flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Centaurea adscendens is adapted to rocky and dry environments, making it a hardy species found in various habitats across southern Europe.
